column1: 28455,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
Well how about that, you are in a place we're calling a kitchen.

You can see an opened conventional looking fridge in the room. The fridge contains a yellow bell pepper, a yellow apple, an orange bell pepper and a carrot. The light flickers for a second, but nothing else happens. You can see an oven. Were you looking for a table? Because look over there, it's a table. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a table, go to TextWorld. The table is massive. On the table you see a cookbook and a knife. You can make out a counter. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a counter, go to TextWorld. The counter appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? You scan the room, seeing a stove. But the thing hasn't got anything on it.

26589,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
You're now in a kitchen. I guess you better just go and list everything you see here.

As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a fridge. The fridge contains an orange bell pepper, a red bell pepper and a white onion, so there's that. You see an oven. Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a table. The table is massive. On the table you can make out a knife. Hmmm... what else, what else? You see a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you make out a banana, a green apple and a cookbook. Classic TextWorld. You smell a fine smell, and follow it to a stove. The stove is conventional. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of garbage.

9912,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
I am honoured to announce that you are now in the kitchen. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call ""looking.""

As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a fridge. The fridge contains a raw pork chop, a block of cheese, a yellow onion and a green bell pepper. You can see an oven. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You make out a table. You shudder, but continue examining the table. On the table you can make out a knife. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a counter. On the counter you make out a cookbook. You see a stove. But the thing is empty, unfortunately.

53573,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
You've entered a kitchen. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building.

You make out an opened fridge. The fridge contains a green bell pepper, a raw red tuna, a green apple, an orange bell pepper, a red apple, a raw white tuna and a red bell pepper. Something scurries by right in the corner of your eye. Probably nothing. A closed oven is in the corner. You see a table. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! On the table you see a cookbook. You make out a counter. On the counter you can make out a red hot pepper, a tomato, a raw yellow potato, a red onion, a green hot pepper and a knife. You see a gleam over in a corner, where you can see a stove. The stove is conventional. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it!

38181,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
You find yourself in a kitchen. A standard one. You decide to just list off a complete list of everything you see in the room, because hey, why not?

As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a fridge. The fridge contains an orange bell pepper, a yellow bell pepper, a green bell pepper, a raw yellow potato and a raw pork chop. You can see a closed oven in the corner. You see a table. On the table you can make out a cookbook. You make out a counter. On the counter you make out a raw red potato, a red hot pepper, a raw purple potato, a green hot pepper and a knife. Look over there! a stove. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a stove? The stove appears to be empty. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

50534,cooking," This is the present state of the game

You make out an opened fridge, which looks conventional, right there by you. The fridge contains a carrot, a raw white tuna, a lettuce and an orange bell pepper. You can make out an oven. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. You scan the room, seeing a table. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! You see a knife on the table. You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a counter. You wonder idly who left that here. You see a raw yellow potato, a yellow onion, a raw red potato and a cookbook on the counter. You make out a stove. But the thing hasn't got anything on it.
There is an open frosted-glass door leading south. You need an exit without a door? You should try going north.

4389,cooking," This is the present state of the game
You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

You can make out a fridge. Now that's what I call TextWorld! The fridge contains a red onion, a red apple, a white onion, a raw white tuna and an orange bell pepper. You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than an oven. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You scan the room, seeing a table. The table is massive. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Oh, great. Here's a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you can make out a raw red potato, a red hot pepper, a raw purple potato, a cookbook and a knife. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a stove. The stove is conventional. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?
There is an open frosted-glass door leading south. You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is not blocked by one.
